terms.name: SSR
terms.definition: Server-Side Rendering — the server generates the HTML for a page on each request and sends fully rendered HTML to the client.

terms.name: SSG
terms.definition: Static Site Generation — HTML pages are generated at build time and served as static files.

terms.name: CSR
terms.definition: Client-Side Rendering — the browser downloads a minimal HTML and renders content using JavaScript on the client.

terms.name: Hydration
terms.definition: The process of attaching client-side JavaScript to server-rendered HTML so the page becomes interactive.

terms.name: ISR
terms.definition: Incremental Static Regeneration — a method to update static pages after build time (Next.js feature).

terms.name: CDN
terms.definition: Content Delivery Network — geographically distributed servers that cache and serve static assets close to users.

terms.name: SPA
terms.definition: Single Page Application — app that loads a single HTML page and dynamically updates content (often uses CSR).
